text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Ideue was born in Kagoshima Prefecture on May 5, 1987. After graduating from Nippon Sport Science University, she joined TEPCO Mareeze. However, the club was disbanded following the Fukushima nuclear disaster in 2011. In June, she joined Nippon TV Beleza.jleague.jp In 2012, she moved to Vegalta Sendai. She retired at the end of the 2015 season.Vegalta Sendai On May 11, 2010, Ideue debuted for the Japan national team against Mexico. ==Statistics== List of match in 2010 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2010 1 0 Total 1 0 ==References== Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Kagoshima Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:TEPCO Mareeze players Category:Nippon TV Tokyo Verdy Beleza players Category:Mynavi Sendai Ladies players
title: Asako Ideue
